intro: Stauritis, commonly known as the common stauritis, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. It typically features compound umbels of small white or greenish flowers, which are often arranged in a distinctive, branched pattern. The leaves are usually pinnately divided, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. The plant is native to Europe and parts of Asia, often found in moist meadows and along stream banks. It is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
